The history of Smash Ultimate will go here.

Super Smash Bros. Ultimate is a unique fighting game where the goal is not to deplete the opponent\'s health, but to launch them off the stage. Each character has a percentage that increases when they take damage. The higher the percentage, the farther you\'ll fly when hit! Use normal attacks, special moves, grabs, and shields to dominate the fight and be the last one standing.
Background with characters from the Smash series

It all started as a prototype called "Dragon King: The Fighting Game," created by Masahiro Sakurai and Satoru Iwata. The idea of including Nintendo characters transformed a simple fighting game into a historic crossover. With only 12 characters, Super Smash Bros. laid the foundation for a unique gameplay style: damage opponents to increase their percentage and launch them off the stage.

Considered by many to be the competitive peak of the series, Melee refined the formula with unprecedented speed and technical depth. It introduced techniques like "wavedashing" which, though unintentional, became the heart of its competitive scene, which endures to this day. It added 25 characters and became a pillar of video game tournaments.

Brawl shifted the pace towards more accessible and chaotic gameplay. Its biggest innovation was "The Subspace Emissary," an adventure mode with a story and cinematics that united the entire Nintendo universe. It was the first to include third-party characters, with the arrival of Solid Snake and Sonic the Hedgehog, breaking all imaginable barriers.

For the first time, the series was released simultaneously on a home console and a handheld. Each version had exclusive stages, and the 3DS version introduced the "Smash Run" mode. The game continued to expand its roster with characters like Mega Man, Pac-Man, and Ryu, and was the first to add DLC fighters, changing the future of the series.

The definitive installment. Ultimate fulfilled every fans dream with the motto "Everyone is Here!", bringing together every character who had ever appeared in the series and adding many more through the Fighters Pass. With over 80 fighters, a polished gameplay system combining the best of Melee and Brawl, and endless content, it has established itself as the best-selling fighting game in history and a monumental celebration of video games.
